key_points: Chris Cuomo, CNN host and brother of Gov. Andrew Cuomo, was photographed giving a peace sign while going to get a COVID-19 vaccine.
The incident came amid allegations that he received preferential COVID-19 testing from his brother's administration.
Chris Cuomo was dressed casually and was on his way to a vaccination center in the Hamptons.
He had previously shared his experience with COVID-19 on his show.
Allegations include that a top state physician visited Cuomo's home to provide COVID-19 tests.
Others allegedly receiving priority testing include Cuomo's mother, brother-in-law, and political associates.
Cuomo spokesman Rich Azzopardi responded that the governor wasn't aware of these actions.
An ethics complaint related to the preferential treatment has been filed by state Senate Minority Leader Rob Ortt.
The situation is part of a broader investigation that could lead to impeachment proceedings against Gov. Andrew Cuomo.
County leaders claim this preferential treatment occurred while requests for expanded testing in nursing homes were partially denied.
